de.hshl.obj.loader

Class OBJLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshl.obj.meta.Reflective.DataClass
      • de.hshl.obj.loader.OBJLoader

  • public class OBJLoader
extends Reflective.DataClass
    Extract geometry and material data from OBJ files.

    Per default, this will load neither texture coordinates nor normals. You can change this behaviour using setLoadNormals(boolean), setLoadTextureCoordinates(boolean).

    Per default, this will print warnings where unsupported data is encountered. You can change this behaviour using setPrintWarnings(boolean).

    See Also:
    loadMesh(Resource), loadSurfaces(Resource), loadMeshObjects(Resource), loadSurfaceObjects(Resource)

    • Method Detail

      • buildPolygonalOBJ

        public static TriangularOBJBuilder buildPolygonalOBJ(TriangularOBJBuilder builder)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Builds the OBJ object using its resource environment and its name.
        Parameters:
        builder - The object which will be filled with information
        Returns:
        The parameter, which has been filled with information.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for any file-related errors.
        DecodingException - for content errors.

      • setPrintWarnings

        public OBJLoader setPrintWarnings(boolean visible)
        Decide whether to print messages for unsupported features. Default is true.
        Parameters:
        visible - If true, warnings for unsupported features will be printed while loading the file.
        Returns:
        the OBJLoader itself

      • setIgnoreThirdTextureCoordinate

        public OBJLoader setIgnoreThirdTextureCoordinate(boolean ignore)
        Decide whether the third texture coordinate should be allowed and ignored. Per default, throws an exception where three-dimensional coordinates are found.
        Parameters:
        ignore - If true, ignore the third texture coordinate. Otherwise, loading an OBJ with 3D coordinates will throw an exception.
        Returns:
        the OBJLoader itself

      • setLoadTextureCoordinates

        public OBJLoader setLoadTextureCoordinates(boolean enabled)
        Decide whether texture coordinates should be loaded. Default is false. Will throw a DecodingException.ConversionException if no texture coordinates are found in the file.
        Parameters:
        enabled - If true, texture coordinates will be loaded from the file.
        Returns:
        the OBJLoader itself

      • setLoadNormals

        public OBJLoader setLoadNormals(boolean enabled)
        Decide whether vertex normals should be loaded. Default is false. Will throw a DecodingException.ConversionException if no vertex normals are found in the file.
        Parameters:
        enabled - If true, vertex normals will be loaded from the file.
        Returns:
        the OBJLoader itself

      • setLoadedStructureKind

        public OBJLoader setLoadedStructureKind(OBJLoader.StructureKind kind)
        Decide which kind of structure should be loaded from the OBJ file: Either OBJLoader.StructureKind.Objects or OBJLoader.StructureKind.Groups. Only matters if you are using loadMeshObjects(Resource) or loadSurfaceObjects(Resource), otherwise groups and objects will be ignored. Default is OBJLoader.StructureKind.Objects.
        Parameters:
        kind - Which OBJLoader.StructureKind should be loaded.
        Returns:
        the OBJLoader itself

      • setGenerateIndexedMeshes

        public OBJLoader setGenerateIndexedMeshes(boolean indexing)
        Decide whether the loaded meshes should be converted to indexed vertex data or only vertex arrays. If disabled, the resulting Meshes will not have indices. Default is false, not resulting in indexing.
        Parameters:
        indexing - If true, fill Mesh.getIndices() with values. Otherwise, only fill Mesh.getVertices() with data.
        Returns:
        the OBJLoader itself

      • setTriangulator

        public OBJLoader setTriangulator(Triangulator triangulator)
        Specify how to triangulate n-gons.
        Parameters:
        triangulator - Default is Triangulator.INDEX_BASED.
        Returns:
        the OBJLoader itself
        See Also:
        Triangulator

      • loadRawOBJData

        public TriangularOBJBuilder loadRawOBJData(Resource resource,
                                           boolean structures,
                                           boolean materials)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Load the specified OBJ resource into a new TriangularOBJBuilder using the current loading configuration. Use this method if you need access to the raw and unprocessed OBJ data.
        Parameters:
        resource - The content source
        materials - Whether to load materials
        structures - Whether to load structures
        Returns:
        The built TriangularOBJBuilder containing the parsed file data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be loaded, including invalid OBJ files.

      • loadMesh

        public Mesh loadMesh(Resource resource)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Load all geometry from the OBJ file into a single Mesh. All objects and groups in the OBJ file will be merged. No Materials will be loaded.

        Will load texture coordinates and normals depending on setLoadTextureCoordinates(boolean) and setLoadNormals(boolean). Meshes will be plain or indexed, depending on setGenerateIndexedMeshes(boolean). 
        
   Path path = Paths.get("resources", "obj", "file.obj"); // path to a resource in your jar file
   Mesh mesh = new OBJLoader().setLoadNormals(true).loadMesh(Resource.bundled(path));
        Parameters:
        resource - The location of the OBJ file. Use Resource.bundled(Path) or Resource.file(Path).
        Returns:
        The geometry of the OBJ file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file or its contents are invalid or incomplete.
        See Also:
        loadSurfaces(Resource), loadMeshObjects(Resource), loadSurfaceObjects(Resource)

      • loadSurfaces

        public java.util.List<Surface> loadSurfaces(Resource resource)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Load all geometry with materials from the OBJ file into a list of Surfaces. All objects and groups in the OBJ file will be merged, but for each Material section in the file, the list will contain a separate Surface.

        Will load texture coordinates and normals depending on setLoadTextureCoordinates(boolean) and setLoadNormals(boolean). Meshes will be plain or indexed, depending on setGenerateIndexedMeshes(boolean). 
        
   Path path = Paths.get("resources", "obj", "file.obj"); // path to a resource in your jar file
   List<Surface> surfaces = new OBJLoader().setLoadNormals(true).loadSurfaces(Resource.bundled(path));
        Parameters:
        resource - The location of the OBJ file. Use Resource.bundled(Path) or Resource.file(Path).
        Returns:
        The material and geometry of the OBJ file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file or its contents are invalid or incomplete.
        See Also:
        loadMesh(Resource), loadMeshObjects(Resource), loadSurfaceObjects(Resource)

      • loadMeshObjects

        public java.util.List<MeshObject> loadMeshObjects(Resource resource)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Load all geometrical objects from the OBJ file into a list of MeshObjects. For each object or group in the file, a separate MeshObject will be created. No Materials will be loaded. Only the geometry which is inside an object or a group will be loaded.

        Will load texture coordinates and normals depending on setLoadTextureCoordinates(boolean) and setLoadNormals(boolean). Meshes will be plain or indexed, depending on setGenerateIndexedMeshes(boolean). Will load either OBJ Groups or OBJ objects from the file, depending on setLoadedStructureKind(StructureKind). 
        
   Path path = Paths.get("resources", "obj", "file.obj"); // path to a resource in your jar file
   List<MeshObject> objects = new OBJLoader().setLoadNormals(true).loadMeshObjects(Resource.bundled(path));
        Parameters:
        resource - The location of the OBJ file. Use Resource.bundled(Path) or Resource.file(Path).
        Returns:
        All geometrical objects or groups of the OBJ file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file or its contents are invalid or incomplete.
        See Also:
        loadMesh(Resource), loadSurfaces(Resource), loadSurfaceObjects(Resource)

      • loadSurfaceObjects

        public java.util.List<SurfaceObject> loadSurfaceObjects(Resource resource)
                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Load all geometrical objects with materials from the OBJ file into a list of SurfaceObjects. For each object or group in the file, a separate SurfaceObject will be created. The contents of each SurfaceObject will be split up to contain a single Mesh per Material. Only the geometry which is inside an object or a group will be loaded.

        Will load texture coordinates and normals depending on setLoadTextureCoordinates(boolean) and setLoadNormals(boolean). Meshes will be plain or indexed, depending on setGenerateIndexedMeshes(boolean). Will load either OBJ Groups or OBJ objects from the file, depending on setLoadedStructureKind(StructureKind). 
        
   Path path = Paths.get("resources", "obj", "file.obj"); // path to a resource in your jar file
   List<SurfaceObject> objects = new OBJLoader().setLoadNormals(true).loadSurfaceObjects(Resource.bundled(path));
        Parameters:
        resource - The location of the OBJ file. Use Resource.bundled(Path) or Resource.file(Path).
        Returns:
        All geometrical objects or groups with materials of the OBJ file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file or its contents are invalid or incomplete.
        See Also:
        loadMesh(Resource), loadSurfaces(Resource), loadMeshObjects(Resource)
